page.title: 15INTERVIEW WITH A GARDENER
page.content: We interviewed John Clark, who is the gardener to Mrs D. Verey who owns Barnesley House and gardens open to the public. It has a Tudor knot garden and a medieval vegetable garden.The gardener John works eight hours a day. He starts work at 7.30 am and works till 3.30 pm.He lives in Cirencester and he comes in his car to work. He has worked there all his life. He said it is hard work in the winter when it is snowy and frosty. All the tools are supplied by the owners. The Vereys have lived there since 1939 and the garden was started in 1960. Altogether the garden is 4 acres.It is very popular with visitors and tourists,and about 500 people go there during the week about 1000 at weekends in summer. The gardener has to answer a lot of questions about the garden.
